intro: Vincetoxicum coddii, commonly known as the Codd's bittersweet, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking red and orange berries that appear in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers in early spring. It thrives in woodland areas and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
